page.title: 14A Day in the Life of........
page.content: The Headmistress of Melin Infants School. Mrs.Jenkins of Melin Infants School gets up at 7-30a.m. She gets to school by car.She usually leaves the school building at around 4-00p.m. The facilities that she uses in the Melin are the Post Office and some shops.She thinks that Melin people care about their schools and education.The number of children in the school has remained stable.They do not have a P.T.A. but mothers often come in to help.The things she wants to change are the nursery playground and she would like an area of grass for the children to play on.She said that the school used to be for children between the ages of 11-14 and then it was an Adult Education Centre before it became an Infants School.
